intro: Neomanniophyton gabunense, commonly known as Gabon starling tree, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often ovate or elliptic in shape. It is typically found growing in moist, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Neomanniophyton gabunense plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various insect and bird species.
